top_categories.workout_context: Bighorn Gravel’s mountain gravel, high altitude demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Bighorn Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Bighorn Gravel’s colorado mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Bighorn Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Bighorn Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Bighorn Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Bighorn Gravel’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Bighorn Gravel’s colorado mountain gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Bighorn Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at Bighorn Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Bighorn Gravel’s 6,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Bighorn Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on colorado mountain gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Bighorn Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Bighorn Gravel with 6,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (7000-9000+ feet); Sun exposure at altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Bighorn Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: mountain gravel, high altitude, significant climbing.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of colorado mountain gravel in Gypsum, Colorado.
